thread.title_full: Bratton Snatches Woman’s Marijuana Joint Near Wall Steet

author: Ryan Haas
title: Bratton Snatches Woman’s Marijuana Joint Near Wall Steet
text:
Share 
New York Police Commissioner Bill Bratton has been patrolling the streets as of recent. 
While walking around Wall Street on Thursday morning, Bratton caught a whiff of the unmistakable odor of burning marijuana. 
“All of a sudden, there it is, that smell,” Bratton told reporters on Friday at a breakfast at New York Law School, according to the New York Post . “Directly in front of us is this young woman, happily puffing away on her way to one of the local schools.” 
“So my security officer came up on one side, I came up on the other and tapped her on the shoulder and she looked over,” Bratton, who presides over a force of more than 35,000 officers, he said at an event on Friday. “And I wish I had a photograph of that face. She instantly recognized me.” 
Bratton said he “politely” took the joint out of the woman’s possession, throwing it into the sewer and letting her go on her way. 
Under new rules pushed forth by Bratton and Mayor Bill de Blasio, possessing less than 25 grams of marijuana is not a crime in New York, but is considered a violation punishable by a fine. Smoking cannabis is public, however, is technically a misdemeanor.
